intro: Nauclea hagenii, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Nauclea hagenii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade.
